label: Comply with DHS Sensitive Systems Policy Directive 4300A
quote: The Contractor will comply with DHS information on security policy, standards, and guidelines, found at the link below:

label: Comply with Federal Travel Regulations for billable travel
quote: The Contractor will comply with the Federal Travel Regulations when travel is billable under this contract.

label: Complete DHS Non-Disclosure Agreement (NDA)
quote: DHS Form 1100-6, Non-Disclosure Agreement can be found at the link below:

label: Adhere to DHS Standards of Conduct
quote: DHS U.S. Customs and Border Protection Directive No. 51735-013A, dated March 13, 2012, Standards of Conduct found at the link below:

label: Conform ICT deliverables to Section 508 Standards
quote: All products, platforms and services delivered as part of this work statement that, by definition, are deemed ICT shall conform to the revised regulatory implementation of Section 508 Standards...

label: Validate ICT deliverables for Section 508 conformance within each iteration and release
quote: When developing or modifying ICT, the Contractor is required to validate ICT deliverables for conformance to the applicable Section 508 requirements. Validation shall occur on a frequency that ensures Section 508 requirements is evaluated within each iteration and release that contains user interface functionality.

label: Do not reduce original ICT Item’s level of Section 508 conformance when modifying, installing, configuring, or integrating ICT
quote: When modifying, installing, configuring or integrating commercially available or government-owned ICT, the Contractor shall not reduce the original ICT Item’s level of Section 508 conformance.

label: Demonstrate Section 508 conformance for electronic documents and forms in Microsoft Office or Adobe PDF format using DHS Accessibility Tests for Documents
quote: When developing or modifying electronic documents and forms provided in a Microsoft Office or Adobe PDF format, the Contractor shall demonstrate conformance to the applicable Section 508 standards (including WCAG Level A and AA Level 2.0 Success Criteria) by conducting testing using the test methods published under 'Accessibility Tests for Documents' at https://www.dhs.gov/compliance-test-processes.

label: Provide Section 508 Conformance Test Plan
quote: the Contractor shall provide a detailed Section 508 Conformance Test Plan. The Test Plan shall describe the scope of components that will be tested, an explanation of the test process that will be used, when testing will be conducted during the project development life cycle, who will conduct the testing, how test results will be reported, and any key assumptions.

label: Provide Section 508 Test Results
quote: the Contractor shall provide test results in accordance with the Section 508 Requirements for Technology Services provided in this solicitation.

label: Provide Accessibility Conformance Report (ACR) for each ICT item
quote: the Offeror shall provide an Accessibility Conformance Report (ACR) to document conformance claims against the applicable Section 508 standards. The ACR shall be based on the Voluntary Product Accessibility Template Version 2.0 508 (or successor versions). Each ACR shall be completed by following all of the instructions provided in the template, including an explanation of the validation method used as a basis for the conformance claims in the report.

label: Design must conform to DHS and CBP Enterprise Architecture, TRM, and all relevant policies and guidelines.
quote: The Offeror shall ensure that the design conforms to the Department of Homeland Security (DHS) and Customs and Border Protection (CBP) Enterprise Architecture (EA), the DHS and CBP Technical Reference Models (TRM), and all DHS and CBP policies and guidelines...

label: Conform to Federal Enterprise Architecture (FEA) model and DHS/CBP versions.
quote: The Offeror shall conform to the Federal Enterprise Architecture (FEA) model and the DHS and CBP versions of the FEA model, as described in their respective EAs.

label: Submit all models using BPMN 1.1 or BPMN 2.0 and CBP Architectural Modeling Standards; UML2 may be used for infrastructure only.
quote: All models will be submitted using Business Process Modeling Notation (BPMN 1.1 or BPMN 2.0 when available) and the CBP Architectural Modeling Standards. Universal Modeling Language (UML2) may be used for infrastructure only.

label: Data semantics must conform to NIEM.
quote: Data semantics shall be in conformance with the National Information Exchange Model (NIEM).

label: Development solutions must ensure compliance with current DHS and CBP target architectures.
quote: Development solutions will also ensure compliance with the current version of the DHS and CBP target architectures.

label: Use DHS/CBP approved products, standards, services, and profiles where possible.
quote: Where possible, the Offeror shall use DHS/CBP approved products, standards, services, and profiles, as reflected by the hardware, software, application, and infrastructure components of the DHS/CBP TRM/standards profile.

label: Coordinate new hardware, software, or infrastructure components through DHS and CBP Technology Insertion (TI) process, including a trade study with at least four alternatives.
quote: If new hardware, software, or infrastructure components are required to develop, test, or implement the program, these products will be coordinated through the DHS and CBP formal Technology Insertion (TI) process (to include a trade study with no less than four alternatives, one of which reflecting the status quo and another reflecting multi-agency collaboration).

label: All developed solutions must be compliant with the Homeland Security (HLS) EA.
quote: All developed solutions shall be compliant with the Homeland Security (HLS) EA.

label: All IT hardware and software must be compliant with the HLS EA.
quote: All IT hardware and software shall be compliant with the HLS EA.

label: Compliance with HLS EA must be derived from and aligned through the CBP EA.
quote: Compliance with the HLS EA shall be derived from and aligned through the CBP EA.
short_label: HLS EA Compliance via CBP EA

label: Submit description information for all data assets, information exchanges, and data standards to EDMO for review, approval, and insertion into DHS Data Reference Model and EA Information Repository.
quote: Description information for all data assets, information exchanges and data standards, whether adopted or developed, shall be submitted to the Enterprise Data Management Office (EDMO) for review, approval, and insertion into the DHS Data Reference Model and Enterprise Architecture Information Repository.

label: Development of data assets, information exchanges, and data standards must comply with DHS Data Management Policy MD 103-01.
quote: Development of data assets, information exchanges, and data standards will comply with the DHS Data Management Policy MD 103-01.

label: All data-related artifacts must be developed and validated according to DHS Data Management Architectural Guidelines.
quote: All data-related artifacts will be developed and validated according to DHS Data Management Architectural Guidelines.

label: Applicability of IPv6 to DHS-related components must be in accordance with DHS EA and OMB Memorandum M-05-22.
quote: Applicability of Internet Protocol version 6 (IPv6) to DHS-related components (networks, infrastructure, and applications) specific to individual acquisitions shall be in accordance with the DHS EA (per OMB Memorandum M-05-22, August 2, 2005), regardless of whether the acquisition is for modification, upgrade, or replacement.
